evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct modules: models, services, utils, and config
Presence of a single entry point (app.py) coordinating various modules
Directory structure shows logical grouping of functionality (e.g., services for business logic, utils for shared tools, models for data structures)
No evidence of distributed communication mechanisms (e.g., message queues, HTTP APIs between components) suggesting a monolithic deployment
Use of Flask framework suggests web application structure but contained within a single deployable unit
Absence of multiple packages or microservice indicators like Dockerfiles per service or inter-service communication patterns
risks: Tight coupling may occur over time if module boundaries are not strictly enforced
Scalability limitations due to monolithic nature
Potential for increased complexity as the codebase grows without clear architectural enforcement
